name: Senseiless
description:
Senseiless  is a game created for reaction time analysis for Aalto University's Game Analysis course by Jesse Nukarinen.  Controls Blocking by defaultUP and DOWN arrowkeys to block everythingBlocking in [Up and Down] modeUP to block up, DOWN to block down The game features 4 different types of rounds, each with two extra modes. The idea is to react and block the foe's attack as fast as possible. The game includes a highscore list for each round type. Rounds:

1. Blind and Deaf  - The round has no audio or edge of screen visual guidance other than the enemy animation

2. Blind - The round has no  edge of screen visual guidance other than the enemy animation. The round does have audio.

3. Deaf - the round has no audio. The round does have edge of screen visual guidance and the enemy animation.

4. Default - The round has audio,  edge of screen visual guidance and the enemy animation.

Modes:

[Up and Down] / [ ^ v ] - The enemy can attack from either up or down. You have to block from the correct side, making the round more challenging.

[Sudden Death] - You have limited time to block the attack. The time decreases as you get a better high score for the round, making the round ever more challenging.
